title: RedWhiteBlue
lyrics:
America!
You know if you travel around this country
You'll notice that it ain't all this
And it ain't all that (USA!)
But it is a little bit of everything
All kinds of places and all kinds of people together



We're all equal, right now we the people

That was the time, we do nor see no evil

It's just blue sky, the winds blowing, the birds fly

In formation, one nation under God

[?] is affliction, Louis Vuitton

That pricey [?] straight up [?]

From the hood to the city, way out in the sticks

The whole world's only got one country like this



What color are you?

Me, I'm RedWhiteBlue

America, throw your hands up

The dream is coming true, let's run it



Say what we like, go anywhere we want

We can love who we wanna and avoid who we don't

We can pray every day, get mad and fight

Raise hell and protest to defend our right

So for the underdogs, we'll still be alright

We made news, we still [?] some happiness in life

Start from the ground and made it up on your own

Another reason to be proud is [?]



What color are you?

Me, I'm RedWhiteBlue

America, throw your hands up

The dream is coming true



What color are you?

Me, I'm RedWhiteBlue

Everybody put your flag up

'Cause this is your land too



Big fields, we eat corn, Kentucky hills

[?] meals, backyard moonshine stills

People of every shade, they hustle to get the bills paid

Long days working, family first for certain

But you can have it worse 'cause soldiers get sent first

Then they come home hurt and they're rolling deep in a [?]

They did it for you 'cause that's what you want

So don't forget to tell 'em thank you for the service



What color are you?

Me, I'm RedWhiteBlue

America, throw your hands up

The dream is coming true



What color are you?

Me, I'm RedWhiteBlue

Everybody put your flag up

'Cause this is your land too



What color are you?

Me, I'm RedWhiteBlue

America, throw your hands up

The dream is coming true



(I said) What color are you?

Me, I'm RedWhiteBlue

Everybody put your flag up

'Cause this is your land too
